conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/isometric-like 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and interior volumes exposed by removing the ceiling/roof.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with readable corners and thickness; elevated angled view; clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some wall corner/edge detailing and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (left bedroom, right bedroom, central bath, small study/utility room, open living/dining/kitchen). Some proportional/layout deviations in the central corridor/partition geometry and several openings (doors/windows) are simplified or not placed exactly as in the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (sofa/TV area, dining table, kitchen blocks, bed(s), basic bathroom fixtures, desk/monitor). One of the two single beds shown in the left bedroom in 2D appears reduced/merged to a single bed in 3D, and some fixture detail is simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/furniture are clearly distinguishable with clean background and minimal artifacts. Lighting is even and geometry is readable, though some door/window details are too minimal to verify precisely.

detected_errors.description: Minor-to-moderate layout/proportion drift in internal partitions/circulation relative to the 2D plan (central corridor/room boundary shaping not perfectly aligned).
Doors/windows are simplified; several openings are not verifiable as matching exact 2D locations/sizes due to missing swing/trim detail.
Left bedroom in 2D shows two single beds; 3D depiction appears to show only one bed (or an incomplete representation).

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong spatial readability and mostly faithful layout, but with some partition/proportion drift and simplified/mismatched openings and bedroom furniture.
